metadata.title: CVE-2023-52472 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: crypto:rsa - add a check for allocation failure Static checkers insist that thempi_alloc() allocation can fail so add a check to prevent a NULLdereference. Small allocations like this can't actually fail in currentkernels, but adding a check is very simple and makes the static checkershappy.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
